channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: US fencers Kiefer and Scruggs take gold and silver in women's individual foil
item.description: The pair made history, with Kiefer becoming the first American woman to earn two gold medals in individual foil. Scruggs became the first Black fencer to medal for the U.S. in an individual women's event.
item.content:encoded:
The pair made history, with Kiefer becoming the first American woman to earn two gold medals in individual foil. Scruggs became the first Black fencer to medal for the U.S. in an individual women's event.

(Image credit: Andrew Medichini)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: French Olympian Leon Marchand trains in the U.S. He thrilled Paris with swimming gold
item.description: On a night when American swimmers scored upsets to add to the U.S. medal count, it was French swimmer Leon Marchand who stole the show in Paris winning his first gold medal.
item.content:encoded:
On a night when American swimmers scored upsets to add to the U.S. medal count, it was French swimmer Leon Marchand who stole the show in Paris winning his first gold medal.

(Image credit: Matthias Schrader)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Kevin Durant powered the U.S. men’s basketball team in Olympic opener against Serbia
item.description: For the U.S. to win its fifth straight Olympic gold medal, the men’s team has to advance out of its four-team group, and then win three consecutive games in the knockout round.
item.content:encoded:
For the U.S. to win its fifth straight Olympic gold medal, the men’s team has to advance out of its four-team group, and then win three consecutive games in the knockout round.

(Image credit: Gregory Shamus)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Torri Huske missed a medal by 1/100th of a second in Tokyo. On Sunday, she won gold
item.description: Her teammate Gretchen Walsh had been favored after setting the world record during Olympic trials in June. But it was Huske who won Paris gold, an emotional win after her "devastating" Tokyo result.
item.content:encoded:
Her teammate Gretchen Walsh had been favored after setting the world record during Olympic trials in June. But it was Huske who won Paris gold, an emotional win after her "devastating" Tokyo result.

(Image credit: Sarah Stier)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: What's inside the mysterious boxed gift Olympic winners get with their medals
item.description: The first trove of medals were awarded this weekend at the Paris Olympics and fans were quick to notice that athletes were handed another prize at the podium.
item.content:encoded:
The first trove of medals were awarded this weekend at the Paris Olympics and fans were quick to notice that athletes were handed another prize at the podium.

(Image credit: Tsvangirayi Mukwazhi)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Thousands battle Western wildfires as smoke puts millions under air quality alerts
item.description: The so-called Park Fire had scorched more than 550 square miles in Northern California as of Sunday, contributing to poor air quality in a large swath of the Northwestern U.S. and western Canada.
item.content:encoded:
The so-called Park Fire had scorched more than 550 square miles in Northern California as of Sunday, contributing to poor air quality in a large swath of the Northwestern U.S. and western Canada.

(Image credit: Nic Coury)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Paris Olympics continue with more swimming medals and the return of Simone Biles
item.description: The first Sunday at the Paris Olympics have been filled with intrigue and drama. American gymnast Simone Biles hurt leg during qualifications, Canada's soccer team got another black eye and swimming has awarded more medals.
item.content:encoded: The first Sunday at the Paris Olympics have been filled with intrigue and drama. American gymnast Simone Biles hurt leg during qualifications, Canada's soccer team got another black eye and swimming has awarded more medals.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: The latest on the investigation into the failed assassination attempt on Trump
item.description: Authorities continue to investigate the gunman who tried to assassinate former President Donald Trump. While a motive for the attack is still unknown, a clearer picture of the shooter is emerging.
item.content:encoded: Authorities continue to investigate the gunman who tried to assassinate former President Donald Trump. While a motive for the attack is still unknown, a clearer picture of the shooter is emerging.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Russia is mostly absent from the Paris Olympics, fielding only a small team
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Retired astronaut Scott Kelly on life in space and Starliner crew's delayed return
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow
